section.title: Validating Server IPMI Configuration
section.p: As part of the IPMI setup, validation that remote commands can be executed is essential.

ol.li:
Install to your workstation the IPMI Utilities from SourceForge:
For Linux - http://sourceforge.net/projects/ipmitool/
For Windows - http://ipmiutil.sourceforge.net/
Validate that you have all the requirements, and that it will run.
Plug your Ethernet port into a switch port that has the same vLAN as your iDRACs.
Configure your network to use an IP address in the iDRAC network range.
Configure the IPMI over LAN Setting to Enabled.

Execute an IPMI command:
for i in $(seq 162 170); do ipmitool –P “password” –U “username” –H 192.168.200.$i power status; done
This will perform a simple, non-destructive poll of the iDRAC from 192.168.200.162 to 192.168.200.170, and then return the power status of on or off.
You can replace the keyword status with reset, off, or on.
Ensure that all machines return responses to the command.
